questions.question_text: On a Catalog Task record, how would an administrator change the priority choice options?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Tested in PDI

choices.D: Open the Data Dictionary > select Values
choices.B: Right-click the Priority Label > select Configure Lists
choices.C: Right-click the Priority Label > select Configure Choices
choices.A: In the Context menu of the form, select Configure Options

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Basic steps per CSA book

questions.question_text: Which sequence of actions applies an update set to an instance?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
CSA book uses these exact examples to explain what a Client Script is.

questions.question_text:
A customer asks you to make the following updates to a form:

1. When Caller field is populated, automatically look up caller location and load it in the Location field.
2. Add notice at the top of the page when the record is submitted.

What type of script would you use to meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
User Interface policies run on the Client side.

questions.question_text:
You are creating a catalog item for ordering a new desktop computer. The computers have these options:


Color: Black or Silver -

RAM: 32 MB or 64MB -

Keyboard: Standard or Ergonomic -

Monitor: 24 inch or 32 inch -

How would you add these options to the catalog item form?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
As per CSA book chapter on Catalog Items/Variables
